overview_summary: All three profiled neighbors have no documented stance on the development (each is classified as "unknown"). In terms of community influence, one neighbor – a local timber company – holds a medium influence due to its business presence, while the other individual landowners have low influence and no public roles.

neighbors.name: Everett Jones Lumber Corporation
neighbors.claims: Everett Jones Lumber Corp is a local timber company operating a planing mill that produces hardwood and softwood lumber and related wood byproducts [Macrae's Blue Book](https://www.macraesbluebook.com/search/company.cfm?company=417178#Products). The company is led by President Everett Jones Jr., who serves as its primary executive contact [Wood List](https://www.woodlist.us/company-everett-jones-lumber-corp-in-spotsylvania-va-30670#contact).

approach_recommendations.engage: Refer to organizational outreach strategy (see ORG table) for engaging this corporate landowner.

neighbors.name: Carrie W. Atkins
neighbors.claims: Carrie W. Atkins’s family has deep roots in Spotsylvania County. Her late husband, Harry Atkins Sr., was a lifelong county resident who was buried in the Atkins family’s private cemetery in Spotsylvania ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/fredericksburg/name/harry-atkins-obituary?id=13096203#:~:text=A%20funeral%20for%20Harry%20Atkins%2C,Atkins%20family%20cemetery%20in%20Spotsylvania)). Her son, Harry Atkins Jr., still resides in Spotsylvania County ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/fredericksburg/name/harry-atkins-obituary?id=13096203#:~:text=and%20was%20a%20member%20of,Mine%20Road%20Baptist%20Church)), indicating the property remains in family hands.
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime local family; no formal role

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate outreach through her son (the property’s point of contact). Emphasize respect for the family’s long-standing connection to the land and reassure that any development will honor their legacy.

neighbors.name: Lenora Burke Gummel
neighbors.claims: Lenora Burke Gummel is a Spotsylvania landowner, but little public information is available about her background or activities ([virginiamercury.com](https://virginiamercury.com/2019/02/25/virginias-biggest-proposed-solar-project-is-also-among-the-most-contentious-local-land-use-fights/#:~:text=Dave%20Hammond%2C%20another%20member%20of,large%20solar%20farms%20are%20found)). Her name does not appear in local news reports or public meeting records on recent development issues, unlike some other adjacent landowners who have spoken out (e.g., Michael O’Bier) ([virginiamercury.com](https://virginiamercury.com/2019/02/25/virginias-biggest-proposed-solar-project-is-also-among-the-most-contentious-local-land-use-fights/#:~:text=%E2%80%9CSomething%E2%80%99s%20got%20to%20click%20in,Site%20A%2C%20for%2032%20years)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use her designated care-of contact (likely a family representative) as the primary liaison. Given her lack of direct involvement, communicate updates through that representative and be prepared to address any concerns via that channel.
